benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/invoicePayments/{paymentId}/tags - Retrieve payment tags

covered: Valid Request: Multiple happy-path scenarios (no params, includedDeleted=true, pluginProperty, audit levels, combined params) validate successful retrieval and HTTP 200 responses.
Empty Response: Scenario TC06 covers the empty result set (no tags) and expects an empty JSON array.
Path parameter validation & error handling: TC08 covers invalid UUID format returning 400; TC07/TC20 cover 404 when payment is not found.
Query parameters: Many variations covered — includedDeleted, pluginProperty, audit, combined params, extra/unexpected params ignored, unsupported audit value tested.
Authorization: TC09 covers missing authentication token (401).

Error handling: TC24 covers 500 Internal Server Error; TC13 covers dependency outage resulting in 503; TC15/TC16 include security-related malformed inputs (SQLi/XSS) and expected safe error responses.
Performance & scale: TC12, TC18 target performance/large payloads and acceptable response times / full payload return.
Regression & integration: TC14 ensures a previously fixed bug is not reintroduced; TC13 addresses service dependency failure.
Resilience & recovery: TC21 covers retry behavior after transient network failure.
Compatibility & accessibility: TC22 covers backward compatibility; TC23 checks for well-formed JSON for accessibility purposes.
gaps: Pagination: No tests for pagination or page/limit/offset semantics when results are large (the guidelines explicitly call this out).
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No scenarios exercise rate limiting or API throttling behavior (burst requests, status 429).
Caching Behavior: No tests for caching headers or conditional requests (ETag, If-None-Match, Cache-Control, Last-Modified) or 304 responses.
Authorization - Forbidden case: There is a test for missing auth (401) but no explicit test for authenticated-but-forbidden (403) when permissions are insufficient.

Input validation for query parameter types: No explicit tests for malformed query parameter values other than audit (e.g., includedDeleted=notBoolean, malformed pluginProperty values beyond XSS test).
Tag schema validation: No tests asserting the Tag object schema (required fields, data types, missing fields, field formats) beyond "array of Tag objects" wording.
Default behavior coverage: No explicit test that audit defaults to NONE and includedDeleted defaults to false (implicit in some tests but not asserted explicitly).
Concurrency / Race conditions: No tests for concurrent modifications (e.g., tags added/removed during retrieval) or soft-delete race conditions.
Rate limits and error headers: No checks for standard error response headers or consistent problem/error schema in error bodies.
recommendations: Add pagination tests: create a payment with many tags and validate pagination parameters (limit/page/offset), boundary conditions (last page, empty page) and that responses include pagination metadata if applicable.
Add rate-limiting/throttling tests: simulate bursts of requests to ensure proper handling (429 responses, Retry-After header) and graceful degradation.
Add caching/conditional-request tests: verify ETag/Cache-Control/Last-Modified headers, behavior for If-None-Match / If-Modified-Since (expect 304 when unchanged), and correct Cache-Control values.
Add forbidden (403) authorization tests: cover scenarios where the user is authenticated but lacks permission to view tags.
Add query-parameter validation tests: include cases like includedDeleted=abc, pluginProperty with invalid formats, extremely long values, and assert 400 responses and clear error messages.
Add Tag schema assertions: validate each returned Tag object fields, types, and formats (e.g., id is UUID, name is string, audit fields when requested).
Add explicit default-parameter tests: verify that omitting audit yields NONE-level info and omitting includedDeleted returns only active tags.
Add concurrency/soft-delete race tests: simulate tag removal/addition during retrieval to validate consistent behavior and idempotency, and verify soft-delete exposure only when includedDeleted=true.
Add tests for error response structure and headers: ensure error bodies do not leak sensitive info and include consistent error codes/messages and expected headers (Content-Type, Cache-Control).
